discussion.content:
B. Disk usage activity of an EC2 instance
C. Memory Utilization of an EC2 instance
Correct Answer: C

C is the answer

Memory Utilization is not in default metrics and need to be acquired via custom metrics

Question should have provided two Options for Custom. ( Disk Usage & mem)
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide//monitoring_ec2.html

Memory and Disk Usage are available only for Ec2 Linux Instances if you use cloudwatch Agent. Also ref question 433 too.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/mon-scripts.html

questions.answer_description:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/DeveloperGuide/ec2-metricscollected.html
CPU, Disk I/O, Data Transfer are default metrics. Memory is not mentioned.

choices.C: Memory Utilization of an EC2 instance
choices.A: Data transfer of an EC2 instance
choices.B: Disk usage activity of an EC2 instance
choices.D: CPU Utilization of an EC2 instance

questions.question_text: Which of the following requires a custom CloudWatch metric to monitor?

questions.answer_description:
Amazon SQS can delete a queue without notification if one of the following actions hasn't been performed on it for 30 consecutive days: SendMessage,
ReceiveMessage, DeleteMessage, GetQueueAttributes, SetQueueAttributes, AddPermission, and RemovePermission.

choices.B: AWS SQS can delete queue after 30 days without notification
choices.A: AWS SQS sends notification after 15 days for inactivity on queue
choices.C: AWS SQS marks queue inactive after 30 days
choices.D: AWS SQS notifies the user after 2 weeks and deletes the queue after 3 weeks.

questions.question_text:
An organization has created a Queue named `modularqueue` with SQS. The organization is not performing any operations such as SendMessage,
ReceiveMessage, DeleteMessage, GetQueueAttributes, SetQueueAttributes, AddPermission, and RemovePermission on the queue. What can happen in this scenario?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service), if a queue is not actively used for 30 consecutive days, it can be automatically deleted by AWS without prior notification. This is an important aspect to consider when managing your resources, as AWS may clean up unused queues to optimize resource usage.

So, in the scenario described, if the organization is not performing any operations on the modularqueue for 30 days, AWS SQS might delete the queue automatically without notifying the user.

Correct Answer: B 
https://forums.aws.amazon.com/ann.jspa?annID=2532
"The SQS documentation states that we reserve the right to delete queues that have been inactive for more than 30 days. So far we have never exercised that right and SQS still stores the metadata for all queues that have not been explicitly deleted. To cleanup those old queues, many of which have not been accessed in years, we will on July 14, 2014 start a purge of all queues that have not been accessed for more than 30 days."
B. AWS SQS can delete queue after 30 days without notification

Selected Answer: D
If an instance has been marked for replacement due to a failed health check triggered by a manual reboot, you can manually change the health status of the instance back to "healthy" using Auto Scaling commands. This would prevent the instance from being terminated and replaced. You can do this by issuing Auto Scaling commands to set the health status of the instance to "healthy," overriding the failed health check status.
Correct Answer: D

D
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/ec2/userguide/healthcheck.html

"After an instance has been marked unhealthy because of an Amazon EC2 or Elastic Load Balancing health check, it is almost immediately scheduled for replacement. It never automatically recovers its health. You can intervene manually by calling the SetInstanceHealth action (or the set-instance-health command) to set the instance's health status back to healthy. If the instance is already terminating, you get an error. Because the interval between marking an instance unhealthy and its actual termination is so small, attempting to set an instance's health status back to healthy with the SetInstanceHealth action (or, set-instance-health command) is probably useful only for a suspended group. For more information, see Suspending and Resuming Scaling Processes. "
D. Change the health of the instance to healthy using the Auto Scaling commands

questions.question_text:
An organization has setup Auto Scaling with ELB. Due to some manual error, one of the instances got rebooted. Thus, it failed the Auto Scaling health check. Auto
Scaling has marked it for replacement. How can the system admin ensure that the instance does not get terminated?

choices.A: Update the Auto Scaling group to ignore the instance reboot event
choices.C: Manually add that instance to the Auto Scaling group after reboot to avoid replacement
choices.B: It is not possible to change the status once it is marked for replacement
choices.D: Change the health of the instance to healthy using the Auto Scaling commands

questions.answer_description:
After an instance has been marked unhealthy by Auto Scaling, as a result of an Amazon EC2 or ELB health check, it is almost immediately scheduled for replacement as it will never automatically recover its health. If the user knows that the instance is healthy then he can manually call the SetInstanceHealth action
(or the as-set instance- health command from CLI. to set the instance's health status back to healthy. Auto Scaling will throw an error if the instance is already terminating or else it will mark it healthy.

questions.question_text: A system admin wants to add more zones to the existing ELB. The system admin wants to perform this activity from CLI. Which of the below mentioned command helps the system admin to add new zones to the existing ELB?

choices.C: It is not possible to add more zones to the existing ELB

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
enable-availability-zones-for-load-balancer

Selected Answer: A
aws elb enable-zones-for-lb --load-balancer-name <ELB name> --availability-zones <list of availability zones>

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/elb/enable-availability-zones-for-load-balancer.html

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/classic/enable-disable-az.html

A is closest to the answer "aws elb enable-availability-zones-for-load-balancer --load-balancer-name my-loadbalancer --availability-zones us-west-2b"

Selected Answer: A
To add an Availability Zone using the AWS CLI, Use the following "enable-availability-zones-for-load-balancer" command to add an Availability Zone

A
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/classic/enable-disable-az.html

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer

questions.answer_description:
AWS Identity and Access Management is a web service which allows organizations to manage users and user permissions for various AWS services. The default maximums for each of the IAM entities is given below:

Groups per AWS account: 100 -

Users per AWS account: 5000 -

Roles per AWS account: 250 -
Number of groups per user: 10 (that is, one user can be part of these many groups).

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Its A as per the question, however values have changed over time.

docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_iam-quotas.html
Correct Answer: A
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_iam-quotas.html

Should be A or B
Groups an IAM user can be a member of = 10

source : https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_iam-limits.html
Groups in an AWS account default limit = 300
This is probably an old question and the values in the answers are outdated.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_iam-limits.html
A. One IAM user can be a part of a maximum of 10 groups
A. One IAM user can be a part of a maximum of 5 groups

questions.question_text: An organization is planning to create a user with IAM. They are trying to understand the limitations of IAM so that they can plan accordingly. Which of the below mentioned statements is not true with respect to the limitations of IAM?

choices.A: One IAM user can be a part of a maximum of 5 groups
choices.B: The organization can create 100 groups per AWS account
choices.D: One AWS account can have 250 roles
choices.C: One AWS account can have a maximum of 5000 IAM users
